content:
That's great to hear! Using a spreadsheet to track your expenses is a fantastic way to stay organized and on top of your finances. It's even more impressive that you've set a monthly budget for gifts and are sticking to it.

With $25 left in your gift budget for the month, you have some flexibility to get a nice gift for your brother's birthday. Considering you've already spent $75, you might want to allocate the remaining amount wisely to get a thoughtful and meaningful gift.

Since you're looking for a watch or a personalized item, you might be able to find something within your budget. If you need some more ideas or inspiration, feel free to share your brother's interests or preferences, and I can try to suggest some options.

Remember to also consider any additional costs, such as shipping or wrapping, when making your final purchase.

You're doing a great job of managing your finances and staying within your budget. Keep up the good work, and I'm sure your brother will appreciate the thought and effort you put into his gift!
